text:
Hi everyone,
Just starting the CMS Developer course.. quick question for you all.. is there any way to extend, clone, or create a "child" version of a theme you purchase of the marketplace?? I'm semi familiar with WordPress, and you were able to create a child theme to extend and enhance a theme.. any help or documentation around that would be much appreciated!!
<@U7SL518D6> - can you modify/enhance premium/paid themes locally?? following this same path?

Hey Benjamin! Right now, you can use the CLI tools to download the default `@HubSpot` themes: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli>. We don't have any themes in the marketplace quite yet, but if you've purchased any (non-theme) templates or modules already, you should be able to either edit them directly in the design manager or again use the CLI to download them and edit them locally

We've been thinking a lot about this idea of extending a theme lately though and I'd love to know what you'd expect out of this experience of enhancing an existing theme (cc: <@ULCSUPTGU> <@U010NEXSY4F>)

Hey Dan! I think a global module might be what you're looking for (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/global-content#creating-a-global-module>). It can be added by the user into pages but only edited in one location.
Can I ask what kinds of modifications you'd like to make? Are you just changing around one file or two just to tweak something, or searching for a faster way to really overhaul the existing theme?
Hi John. Is this still happening?
unfortunately this is happening to everyone, so I don’t think it’s session/browser related
Working for me, but I'd look into any errors you have on your base template or header files. I saw some weirdness the other day and it was related to a missmatched end tag
this is happening with a global module inside of a global partial. Can you update in that scenario? The values of the global module are not taking effect in the global partial
Interesting, not put a partial in a global element. I'll jump in and try that out and see if I have an error later this afternoon.
the other way around, though. Global Module inside of a global partial.
What's the logic behind that just so I understand. But I'll try it nonetheless

global module is social network icons (they will be the same everywhere)

global partial is a footer
I would assume in comparison to wordpress the theme layer in HS is a bit thinner and we dont need theme updates?
